intro: Sinapis baetica, commonly known as Spanish mustard or wild mustard, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and North Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other mustard species. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and features yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are pinnately lobed and often have a strong, pungent aroma. Sinapis baetica is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
